item.title: thought-leaders
item.description: definition: someone has a single solution that seems to fit every problem. In this post, Adam Gordon Bell discuss the advices given by thought-leaders. In his research he found the work of Philip E. Tetlock on the decision-making process of experts. Tetlock was able to split the group of experts in his research broadly in two groups: the hedgehogs and foxes. hedgehog has one big idea like “free-market capitalism” which they use as a lens to look at many issues they are “confident forecasters” foxes they have complicated advice and were skeptical of even their own predictions less likely to be famous because their advices are harder to explain in a sound bite When all predictions were added up and scores, hedgehogs lost out to foxes.
